## The Open Science Framework {.nostretch .smaller}

[OSF](https://osf.io) is a __free__ and __open source__ project management tool, created by the [Center for Open Science ](https://www.cos.io/), that supports researchers throughout their entire project lifecycle.

[![](images/cos-2023-figure-3.png){fig-align="center" width=40% style="padding-top: 10px;"}](https://doi.org/10.17605/OSF.IO/ZE6WT)

::: footer
(Reproduced from the [Center for Open Science](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X07mBq2tnMg))
:::

## Git & GitHub {.smaller}

Git is a version control system created by [Linus Torvalds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linus_Torvalds) in 2005 while building the [Linux](https://www.linux.org/) kernel. It allows multiple people to work on a project simultaneously without interfering with each other's changes.
